alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 12 at 4:07AM MST until September 12 at 5:15AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM MST EARLY THIS MORNING FOR FAR WESTERN YAVAPAI COUNTY... At 402 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms showers and thunderstorms in western Yavapai County including Bagdad and vicinity. Rainfall intensity has decreased, with most areas receiving light rain. However, between 0.75 and 2.5 inches of rain fell earlier this morning, with Bagdad Airport reporting 2.28 inches. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bagdad and Mount Hope. This includes the following highways... Highway 93 between mile markers 149 and 176. State Route 96 between mile markers 0 and 16. State Route 71 between mile markers 90 and 94. State Route 97 between mile markers 156 and 166. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Iron Spring Wash, Boulder Creek, Santa Maria River, Little Sycamore Wash, Date Creek, Burro Creek, Trout Creek, Muddy Creek, Adobe Creek, Bear Creek and Peoples Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
